snippet: Fred Wilpon and Saul Katz are to pay $16 million this week and $45 million and interest over the next four years to the trustee representing the victims of Bernard L. Madoff and his Ponzi scheme.
abstract: New York Mets owners Fred Wilpon and Saul Katz prepare to begin making payments to trustee representing victims of Bernard L Madoff's Ponzi scheme; currently owe $61 million under settlement, which will likely be reduced as more money is recovered.
lead_paragraph: Fred Wilpon and Saul Katz are to pay $16 million this week and $45 million and interest over the next four years to the trustee representing the victims of Bernard L. Madoff and his Ponzi scheme.

headline.main: Mets’ Owners to Begin Paying Settlement Owed in Madoff Fraud Case
headline.print_headline: Owners of Mets Get Relief in Lawsuit
